abstract: Leaders of the Senate Banking Committee said that they agreed to limit the likelihood of a taxpayer bailout of big banks, but liberal Democrats said they would push for reducing the size of the nation’s biggest banks.
snippet: Leaders of the Senate Banking Committee said that they agreed to limit the likelihood of a taxpayer bailout of big banks, but liberal Democrats said they would push for reducing the size of the nation’s biggest banks.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Leaders of the Senate Banking Committee said Tuesday that they had reached an agreement to limit the likelihood that big banks would be bailed out by taxpayers. But liberal Democrats said they also would push aggressively for an array of proposals that could force some of the nation’s biggest banks to reduce their size.

headline.main: Bill Drops Fund to Shut Failed Banks
headline.print_headline: Bill Drops Fund to Shut Failed Banks

byline.original: By Edward Wyatt and David M. Herszenhorn

abstract: The Senate approved two amendments that both Democrats and Republicans claimed would end the prospect of bailouts for companies deemed “too big to fail.”
snippet: The Senate approved two amendments that both Democrats and Republicans claimed would end the prospect of bailouts for companies deemed “too big to fail.”
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate on Wednesday approved two amendments to the financial regulatory bill that both Democrats and Republicans claimed would end the prospect of taxpayer-financed bailouts for companies deemed “too big to fail.”

headline.main: 2 Votes Break Logjam on Financial Overhaul Bill
headline.print_headline: 2 Votes Break Logjam on Financial Overhaul Bill

byline.original: By Edward Wyatt and David M. Herszenhorn
